raw_transcript: Interviewer: Can you tell me what brought you in? Respondent: I've been having this dull ache in my chest for about a week. It sits near the left side and sometimes goes up toward my neck. The first time was when I was gardening for a while. It comes on when I'm moving around and settles when I stop. Interviewer: How often has it happened? Respondent: Three times this week—gardening, walking my dog, and once it even woke me up. The longest was maybe half an hour and I got worried. Interviewer: Do you get sweaty or sick with it? Respondent: No, I don't get sweaty or throw up. Just short of breath while it hurts. Interviewer: Any medical problems? Respondent: I was told I had high blood pressure a few years ago but stopped the pills because they made me sleepy. I had an ulcer way back in the 90s but it got better. Interviewer: Do you drink or smoke? Respondent: I don't smoke. I have a beer or two on weekends and a glass of wine with dinner once a week. Interviewer: Any heart issues in the family? Respondent: My dad died of a heart attack at 54. Mom is alive and well. No brothers or sisters. Interviewer: Medicines or allergies? Respondent: I'm not on anything now—just take ibuprofen sometimes for headaches. I'm allergic to penicillin; it gave me a rash years ago.
raw_case: Clinical Profile: 56-year-old White female, referred from ED, info source patient. Chief complaint: chest pain for the past week. HPI: abrupt onset dull aching chest pain, left parasternal radiating to neck, first during gardening after 45 minutes. Associated shortness of breath. No sweating, nausea, vomiting, dizziness, or palpitations. Duration 5–30 minutes, three episodes (gardening 5–10 min resolved with rest; walking dog 15 min resolved rest; woke from sleep 30 min leading to ED). Relieved by rest; no change with body movement or food; denies GERD symptoms or tenderness. PMH: hypertension diagnosed 3 years ago, stopped medication due to drowsiness. PUD 1990 resolved with cimetidine (3 months). Surgery: 1994 TAH-BSO for fibroids; 1998 bunionectomy. No known heart, lung, cancer. Allergies: penicillin rash/hives (1985). Social: alcohol 1–2 beers each weekend and 1 glass wine weekly; no tobacco or drugs; meds: none prescribed; occasional OTC ibuprofen every other day for headaches. Family: mother 79 healthy; father died 54 heart attack; no siblings; family conditions hypertension, premature CAD, no diabetes/cancer. ROS: HEENT negative; cardiovascular only chest pain/SOB as above; GI occasional nighttime epigastric burning twice monthly, no dysphagia/nausea/vomiting/stool changes; GU negative; MSK weekly low back ache after gardening relieved by Tylenol; neuro negative.
doctor_script: Can you tell me more about the chest discomfort you've been feeling?
What were you doing when it first started, and does anything trigger it now?
Does resting or changing position affect the pain?
Do you notice sweating, nausea, or dizziness when the pain happens?
Are you taking any medications for blood pressure or other conditions?
Any family history of heart problems or early heart attacks?
